alert.note: Alert for Kings (Brooklyn) (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued September 22 at 2:55PM EDT until September 24 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM SATURDAY TO 11 AM EDT SUNDAY... ...COASTAL FLOOD STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents. For the High Surf Advisory, breaking waves of 3 to 6 feet expected in the surf zone. For the Coastal Flood Statement, up to one half foot of inundation above ground level expected in vulnerable areas near the waterfront and shoreline. * WHERE...Kings (Brooklyn) County. * WHEN...For the High Rip Current Risk, through Sunday evening. For the High Surf Advisory, from 6 AM Saturday to 11 AM EDT Sunday. For the Coastal Flood Statement, Saturday afternoon. * COASTAL FLOOD IMPACTS...Brief minor flooding of the most vulnerable locations near the waterfront and shoreline during the time of high tide. * BEACH EROSION AND FLOODING IMPACTS...Breaking waves of 3 to 6 ft will cause beach flooding and erosion, with localized dune erosion possible, during the time of high tide. * SWIMMING IMPACTS...Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. Life- threatening rip currents are likely for all people entering the surf zone. Anyone visiting the beaches should stay out of the surf. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. NEW YORK HARBOR AT THE BATTERY NY MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 7.0 FT, MODERATE 8.3 FT, MAJOR 9.4 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.9 FT, MODERATE 3.2 FT, MAJOR 4.3 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 23/03 PM 6.8/ 7.3 1.7/ 2.2 1.8/ 2.2 1 MINOR 24/04 AM 5.7/ 6.2 0.7/ 1.1 1.8/ 2.2 1 NONE ROCKAWAY INLET NY NEAR FLOYD BENNETT FIELD NY MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 7.6 FT, MODERATE 8.6 FT, MAJOR 9.6 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 2.0 FT, MODERATE 3.0 FT, MAJOR 4.0 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 23/03 PM 7.3/ 7.8 1.7/ 2.2 1.9/ 2.3 4-5 MINOR 24/03 AM 6.2/ 6.8 0.7/ 1.1 1.9/ 2.3 5 NONE JAMAICA BAY AT INWOOD NY MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 7.8 FT, MODERATE 8.5 FT, MAJOR 9.3 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.6 FT, MODERATE 2.3 FT, MAJOR 3.1 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 23/03 PM 7.6/ 8.1 1.4/ 1.9 1.7/ 2.2 0 MINOR 24/04 AM 6.5/ 7.0 0.2/ 0.8 1.7/ 2.2 0 NONE &&
info.instruction: Do not drive through flooded roadways. Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions. If you enter the surf zone, always have a flotation device with you and swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float, and do not swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and yell or wave for help.
